title: Mexico's Raul Jimenez back to his best ahead of Concacaf Nations League: How Fulham's faith aided return
text:
Mexico’s Raul Jimenez back to his best ahead of Concacaf Nations League: How Fulham’s faith aided return
Raul Jimenez is back to form for Mexico ahead of the Concacaf Nations League semifinal against Canada, showcasing a remarkable recovery from a serious skull fracture incurred in 2020. At 33, Jimenez has reinvigorated his career, proving he deserves to lead El Tri alongside rising star Santiago Gimenez. After a slow start at Fulham, Jimenez's resurgence includes reaching double-digit goals this season, sparking debates over his pivotal role in both club and national teams.
By the Numbers- Jimenez has accumulated over 14 expected goals and assists, ranking ninth in the Premier League.
- He takes more shots per 90 minutes than stars like Erling Haaland and Mohamed Salah.
- Jimenez has scored crucial goals, including an equalizer against Newcastle and a brace ensuring his status as Mexico's top scorer in the English top flight.
- Fulham's trust in Jimenez has been rewarded with significant contributions, helping them in their push for European competition.
As Mexico prepares for their semifinal match, Jimenez's current form will be critical. His experience and performance will potentially shape the outcome against Canada, determining his place in the squad for future matches.
Bottom LineRaul Jimenez's impressive return emphasizes his importance to both Fulham and the Mexican national team, proving that resilience and opportunity can rejuvenate a career. His continued performance will be vital in Mexico's quest for success in the upcoming Nations League.
